perturbation.original_text:
1.20 “Person” a human being or group of human beings, a company, corporation, a partnership or other legal entity (artificial or juristic
person) recognized by law as having rights and duties.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.20 “Person” a human being, excluding group of human beings, a company, corporation, a partnership or other legal entity (artificial or juristic
person) recognized by law as having rights and duties.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Person' now excludes 'group of human beings', which directly contradicts the original inclusive definition. This affects interpretation of rights and duties involving multiple individuals.

perturbation.original_text:
1.21 “Products” means the ENERGOUS products set forth in  Exhibit A, as such Exhibit may be amended from time to time by mutual
agreement between the parties, that have been released by ENERGOUS to production, including all Product Updates, which will be deemed to have
been added to Exhibit A automatically, without any further action required by the parties, immediately following the release to production date.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.21 “Products” means the ENERGOUS products set forth in  Exhibit A, as such Exhibit may be amended from time to time by mutual
agreement between the parties, that have been released by ENERGOUS to production, excluding Product Updates, which will not be deemed to have been added to Exhibit A automatically unless Energous notifies Dialog in writing of such updates.
perturbation.explanation: The modified definition of Products now excludes automatic inclusion of 'Product Updates' in Exhibit A, requiring separate written notification from ENERGOUS. This contradicts the original definition that automatically includes Product Updates.

perturbation.original_text:
20.1 Notices. All notices required or permitted under this Agreement will be in writing, reference this Agreement and be deemed given: (a)
when delivered personally; or (b) when sent by electronic mail with electronic confirmation of receipt, provided that such notice is immediately
confirmed as provided in (c) or (d) below; or (c) seven (7) days after having been sent by registered or certified mail,; or (d) two (2) days after
deposit with a commercial courier service, with written verification of receipt.
perturbation.changed_text:
20.1 Notices. All notices required or permitted under this Agreement will be in writing, reference this Agreement and be deemed given: (a)
when delivered personally; or (b) when sent by electronic mail, regardless of electronic confirmation of receipt; or (c) fourteen (14) days after having been sent by registered or certified mail; or (d) five (5) days after deposit with a commercial courier service, with written verification of receipt.
perturbation.explanation: The notice period is now changed for (b), (c), and (d). Before, (b) needed electronic confirmation, now it doesn't. (c) was 7 days, now it is 14, and (d) was 2 days, now it is 5. This makes the timing of the notices ambiguous.
